items.name: npm or github
items.description: You can install xng via npm or download it directly from the xng github repository

items.name: Requirements
items.description:
xng requires lodash and is tested under the current version 4.17.4.
Include requirements at the end of the body tag to prevent the browser from blocking. Moreover xng is built with the fetch api and therefore requires the browser to support it!

items.name: init xng via javascript
items.description: start your xng in your main entry point. in this website we use the github page's index.html

items.name: Concept
items.description: xng has been designed for offering a short and simple api and therefore works with only 4 HTML5 custom attributes.

items.name: Routing
items.description:
xng routing is realized via the window location's hash value. This means the main page will be accessible e.g. at 
https://ramsondon.github.io/xng
and the changelog page will be at
https://ramsondon.github.io/xng/#changes
and 
https://ramsondon.github.io/xng/#changelog

items.name: Views
items.description: xng views are included automatically asynchronously via the "data-xng-view" attribute

items.name: Models
items.description:
a model or view data can be automatically assigned via the "data-xng-model" attribute or can be assigned directly as objects using the 
_.xng.assign(<object>)
method

items.name: API Reference
items.description: xng's javascript api is being listed in this section

items.name: _.xng.assign
items.description: serializes an object and escapes the serialized object

items.name: _.xng.base
items.description: sets the base directory prefix for loading templates and models

items.name: _.xng.fetch
items.description: fetches a resource as type "text" or "json"

items.name: _.xng.listen
items.description: listens to one or more specific view rendered events

items.name: _.xng.put
items.description: puts specific content to a given dom selector

items.name: _.xng.require
items.description: includes one or more javascript files asynchronously and offers a callback on loaded

items.name: _.xng.route
items.description: listens to one or more specified routing events
